title.narrative: WASH EPRP:Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) PROGRAMME

description.narrative: Effective Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) preparedness and response for emergency affected population delivered in line with CCCs., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Target population in conflict-affected, underserved, and epidemic-prone communities in South Sudan have improved access to equitable and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services by 2018.

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTORATE OF WATER AND SANITATION STATE MINISTRY OF COOPERATIVE AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT NORTHERN BAHR EL
STATE MINISTRY OF SOCIAL DEVELOPMEN CULTURE YOUTH AND SPORT

WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective WASH preparedness and response for emergency affected population delivered in line with CCCs.

description.narrative: In 2018, UNICEF provided access to safe water for 520,221 people and safe sanitation for 158,274 people. UNICEF continued providing leadership for water, sanitation and hygiene cluster coordination, programme management, core supply pipeline for cluster partners and information management for better preparedness and response. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:19/12/2018

title.narrative: of states with emergency contingency plans
People in humanitarian situations who access and use adequate sanitation and hygiene facilities
UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
